front.title: The Real Time Transport Protocol (RTP) Denial of Service (Dos) Attack and its Prevention(

abstract.t: The Real Time Transport Protocol (RTP) provides unreliable transportof real time media from a sender to one or more recipients. RTPsessions are typically set up through signaling protocols such as theSession Initiation Protocol (SIP) or the Real Time Streaming Protocol(RTSP). When RTP is set up with these protocols, a potential Denialof Service (DoS) attack is introduced. This attack allows an attackerto cause a flood of RTP packets to be sent towards a target. Wedescribe this attack, and also show how it is effectively preventedusing Interactive Connectivity Establishment (ICE), first introducedas a means of handling Network Address Translator (NAT) traversal.
